title: Experimental Hybrid Model for Digital Game-Based Competitive Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Core gamification-based learning principles and understanding of competitive learning mechanisms
context.additional_context: Explores methods for pre-service teachers to design and evaluate digital game-based competitive learning models in mathematics education. Analyzes the effectiveness of social competition and self-competition mechanisms based on learners' ability levels.

learning_goals: Learners can design digital game-based learning environments incorporating social and self-competition mechanisms for diverse proficiency levels.
Learners can evaluate the impact of competition mechanism selection on learning outcomes and anxiety levels by analyzing learner data.
Learners can propose an optimized competition-based learning framework for different proficiency levels through project deliverables.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
